variants.HGVS: N.D. (Note: The literature doesn't provide the original HGVS nomenclature for these variants, and without original information, API standardization can't be done. Here we mark as N.D.)

Description in input context.CΔ145: (CΔ145) PINK1 (the number represents amino acid residues deleted from the C - terminal end)

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Confocal imaging of mitochondrial membrane potential

Material used.Material Name: Cultured SN dopaminergic neurons from PINK1 knockout mice
Material used.Description: Cultured SN dopaminergic neurons were prepared from postnatal 3 - or 4 - day - old wild - type or PINK1 -/- mice.

Readout description.Conclusion: For PINK1 -/- neurons: Abnormal (depolarized ΔΨm); For wild - type PINK1 overexpressed in PINK1 -/- neurons: Normal; For PARK6 mutants (G309D), (E417G) or (CΔ145) overexpressed in PINK1 -/- neurons: Abnormal
Readout description.Molecular Effect: For PARK6 mutants: loss - of - function in maintaining ΔΨm
Readout description.Result Description: Compared to wild - type SN dopaminergic cells, TMRM fluorescent intensity was significantly reduced in PINK1 -/- SN dopaminergic neurons, indicating a depolarized mitochondrial membrane potential. Wild - type PINK1 overexpression increased TMRM fluorescence intensity and restored normal ΔΨm in PINK1 -/- SN dopaminergic neurons. PARK6 mutant (G309D), (E417G) or (CΔ145) PINK1 was defective in increasing TMRM fluorescence signal and reversing depolarized ΔΨm of PINK1 -/- SN dopaminergic cells.

Basic positive control.Description: Infection of adenoviruses containing cDNA of wild - type ataxin - 3 - Q22 did not affect TMRM signal and mitochondrial membrane potential of PINK1 - null SN dopaminergic cells (used as a control to show wild - type overexpression effect)

Basic negative control.Description: Infection of adenoviruses containing cDNA of GFP did not affect TMRM signal and mitochondrial membrane potential of PINK1 - null SN dopaminergic cells (used as a control to show non - specific effect)

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: All results are expressed as the mean ± SE value of n experiments. Statistical significance among multiple experimental groups was determined by one - way ANOVA followed by Dunnett's test. Unpaired Student's t - test (two - tailed) was used to determine the significant difference between two groups of data. A P value < 0.05 was considered significant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal TMRM fluorescence intensity indicating hyperpolarized ΔΨm as seen in wild - type SN dopaminergic neurons

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Reduced TMRM fluorescence intensity indicating depolarized ΔΨm as seen in PINK1 -/- SN dopaminergic neurons

Material used.Material Name: Cultured SN dopaminergic neurons from PINK1 knockout mice
Material used.Description: Cultured SN dopaminergic neurons were prepared from postnatal 3 - or 4 - day - old wild - type or PINK1 -/- mice.

Readout description.Conclusion: For PINK1 -/- neurons: Abnormal (fragmented mitochondria); For wild - type PINK1 overexpressed in PINK1 -/- neurons: Normal; For PARK6 mutants (G309D), (E417G) or (CΔ145) overexpressed in PINK1 -/- neurons: Abnormal
Readout description.Molecular Effect: For PARK6 mutants: loss - of - function in maintaining normal mitochondrial morphology
Readout description.Result Description: In the majority (~95%) of wild - type SN dopaminergic neurons, mitochondria displayed a normal long thread - like tubular structure. Fragmented mitochondria were only found in about 5% of wild - type dopaminergic cells. The percentage of dopaminergic neurons (42 ± 4%; n = 5 experiments) with fragmented mitochondria was greatly increased in PINK1 - deficient SN neuronal culture. Overexpression of wild - type PINK1 restored long thread - like morphology of mitochondria in PINK1 - deficient dopaminergic neurons. Overexpression of PARK6 mutant (G309D), (E417G) and (CΔ145) PINK1 failed to significantly decrease the percentage of PINK1 - deficient dopaminergic cells with fragmented mitochondria.

Biological replicates.Description: In each experiment, mitochondrial morphology of 20 wild - type or PINK1 - null dopaminergic neurons was analyzed. Each bar represents the mean ± SE value of 5 experiments.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: All results are expressed as the mean ± SE value of n experiments. Statistical significance among multiple experimental groups was determined by one - way ANOVA followed by Dunnett's test. Unpaired Student's t - test (two - tailed) was used to determine the significant difference between two groups of data. A P value < 0.05 was considered significant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: ≥90% of mitochondria with long thread - like tubular structure (inferred from literature data)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: ≥10% of mitochondria truncated and shortened (<1.5 μm) (as defined in the literature)

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Confocal imaging of mitochondrial superoxide and H₂O₂ - induced ROS generation

Material used.Material Name: Cultured SN dopaminergic neurons from PINK1 knockout mice
Material used.Description: Cultured SN dopaminergic neurons were prepared from postnatal 3 - or 4 - day - old wild - type or PINK1 -/- mice.

Readout description.Conclusion: For PINK1 -/- neurons: Abnormal (increased ROS); For wild - type PINK1 overexpressed in PINK1 -/- neurons: Normal; For PARK6 mutants (G309D), (E417G) or (CΔ145) overexpressed in PINK1 -/- neurons: Abnormal
Readout description.Molecular Effect: For PARK6 mutants: loss - of - function in inhibiting ROS formation
Readout description.Result Description: Compared to wild - type SN dopaminergic cells, MitoSOX Red fluorescence intensity (indicator of mitochondrial superoxide level) was significantly increased in PINK1 -/- dopaminergic neurons. Wild - type PINK1 overexpression greatly reduced MitoSOX Red fluorescence signal and mitochondrial superoxide generation. Overexpression of PARK6 mutant (G309D), (E417G) or (CΔ145) PINK1 was defective in decreasing mitochondrial level of superoxide. Also, compared to wild - type SN dopaminergic cells, H₂O₂ (1 mM) - induced DCF fluorescence and ROS formation was greatly augmented in PINK1 -/- dopaminergic neurons. Wild - type PINK1 overexpression significantly attenuated H₂O₂ - evoked DCF fluorescence signal and ROS production. Overexpression of PARK6 mutant (G309D), (E417G) or (CΔ145) PINK1 failed to significantly inhibit H₂O₂ - induced DCF fluorescence and ROS generation in PINK1 - null dopaminergic neurons.

Biological replicates.Description: Each bar represents the mean ± SE value of 25 - 30 neurons for MitoSOX Red staining and 25 neurons for CM - H₂DCFDA staining.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: All results are expressed as the mean ± SE value of n experiments. Statistical significance among multiple experimental groups was determined by one - way ANOVA followed by Dunnett's test. Unpaired Student's t - test (two - tailed) was used to determine the significant difference between two groups of data. A P value < 0.05 was considered significant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: MitoSOX Red and DCF fluorescence intensity similar to that of wild - type SN dopaminergic neurons

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Increased MitoSOX Red and DCF fluorescence intensity compared to wild - type SN dopaminergic neurons

Experiment Method.Assay Method: MTT assay for analysis of neuronal death

Material used.Material Name: Cultured SN neurons from PINK1 knockout mice
Material used.Description: Cultured SN neurons were prepared from postnatal 3 - or 4 - day - old wild - type or PINK1 -/- mice.

Readout description.Conclusion: For PINK1 -/- neurons: Abnormal (enhanced rotenone - induced cell death); For wild - type PINK1 overexpressed in PINK1 -/- neurons: Normal; For PARK6 mutants (G309D), (E417G) or (CΔ145) overexpressed in PINK1 -/- neurons: Abnormal
Readout description.Molecular Effect: For PARK6 mutants: loss - of - function in protecting against rotenone - induced cell death
Readout description.Result Description: Compared to 6 - to 7 - day - old wild - type neuronal culture of SN, rotenone - induced cell death of dopaminergic neurons was significantly enhanced in PINK1 - deficient SN neuronal culture. Overexpression of wild - type PINK1 significantly prevented the augmentation of rotenone (150 nM) - induced cell death in PINK1 -/- SN neuronal culture. Infecting PINK1 - null SN neurons with recombinant adenoviruses containing the cDNA of mutant (G309D), (E417G) or (CΔ145) PINK1 did not inhibit enhancement of rotenone - induced neuronal death.

Biological replicates.Description: Each bar shows the mean ± SE value of 4 - 5 experiments.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: All results are expressed as the mean ± SE value of n experiments. Statistical significance among multiple experimental groups was determined by one - way ANOVA followed by Dunnett's test. Unpaired Student's t - test (two - tailed) was used to determine the significant difference between two groups of data. A P value < 0.05 was considered significant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell death rate similar to that of wild - type SN neuronal culture without rotenone treatment (inferred)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Increased cell death rate compared to wild - type SN neuronal culture with the same rotenone treatment
